Author: Jac Semmler
Title: Super Bloom: A Field Guide to Flowers for Every Gardener
Description: A practical flower-growing guide with plant profiles and advice for designing and caring for a blooming garden.

Author: Will Buxton
Title: Grand Prix: An Illustrated History of Formula 1
Description: An illustrated overview of Formula 1’s history; key drivers; teams; cars; and defining moments.

Author: Tom Newton
Title: How Cars Work: An Illustrated Guide for Curious Kids; Teens; and Beginners
Description: A diagram-led introduction to how car systems like engines; brakes; and transmissions function.

Author: Lonely Planet
Title: Lonely Planet’s Where to Go When
Description: A month-by-month travel inspiration guide recommending destinations based on the best times to visit.

Author: Alessandro Di Lullo; János Barberis; Tamás Haiman
Title: The EdTech Book: The World’s First Crowdsourced Book on EdTech
Description: A crowdsourced collection of perspectives and practical ideas on education technology and learning innovation.

Author: Frida Ramstedt
Title: The Interior Design Handbook
Description: A practical guide to core interior design principles like layout; proportion; lighting; and styling.

Author: Robin Barton
Title: 101 Weekends in Europe
Description: A curated travel guide of weekend trip ideas across Europe with highlights and planning inspiration.

Author: Chinese Express
Title: Talk Chinese
Description: A beginner-focused Chinese phrasebook/course aimed at everyday communication and basic conversation.

Author: Heather Thomas
Title: The Sweet Potato Cookbook
Description: A recipe collection centered on sweet potatoes across meals sides and desserts.

Author: Janelle Shane
Title: You Look Like a Thing and I Love You
Description: A funny and accessible tour of AI’s weird failures and what they reveal about machine learning.

Author: Cathy O’Neil
Title: Weapons of Math Destruction
Description: An argument about how opaque algorithms can scale harm and reinforce inequality in real-world systems.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
Description: A collection of Hawking’s reflections on major scientific and philosophical questions about the universe and humanity’s future.

Author: Peter Thiel; Blake Masters
Title: Zero to One: Notes on Startups; or How to Build the Future
Description: A startup manifesto arguing that real progress comes from creating new things rather than copying competitors.

Author: James O’Brien
Title: How Not to Be Wrong: The Art of Changing Your Mind
Description: A personal exploration of how beliefs form and how to rethink them in a polarized world.

Author: Carol S. Dweck
Title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
Description: A popular psychology book contrasting fixed vs growth mindsets and how they affect learning and achievement.

Author: George Orwell
Title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
Description: A dystopian novel about totalitarian control; surveillance; and the manipulation of truth.

Author: George Orwell
Title: Animal Farm
Description: A political allegory in which farm animals overthrow humans only to watch power corrupt the revolution.

Author: Daniel Kahneman; Olivier Sibony; Cass R. Sunstein
Title: Noise: A Flaw in Human Judgment
Description: A book about inconsistency in judgments and how “noise” quietly worsens decisions in institutions.

Author: Robert Habeck
Title: Von hier an anders
Description: unknown

Author: Anne Frank
Title: The Diary of a Young Girl
Description: The wartime diary of a Jewish teenager hiding from Nazi persecution in Amsterdam.

Author: Gerd Gigerenzer
Title: How to Stay Smart in a Smart World
Description: An argument for why human judgment and heuristics still matter in an age of algorithms and data overload.

Author: Ankur Warikoo
Title: Do Epic Shit
Description: A motivational advice book on habits
column6: and personal growth framed in short

Author: Jack London
Title: The Sea-Wolf
Description: An adventure novel about a shipwreck survivor forced to confront a brutal captain and harsh survival at sea.

Author: Levy Rozman
Title: How to Win at Chess
Description: A beginner-friendly chess improvement guide focusing on core principles; tactics; and practical play.

Author: Wolfgang Herrndorf
Title: Tschick
Description: A coming-of-age road trip novel about two teenage outsiders taking a stolen car across Germany.

Author: Bryn Thomas
Title: Trans-Siberian Handbook: The Trailblazer Guide to the Trans-Siberian Railway Journey
Description: A practical guide to planning and riding the Trans-Siberian Railway with city stops and logistics.

Author: Randall Munroe
Title: (German) How To: Absurd Scientific Advice for Common Real-World Problems
Description: Comedic “how-to” scenarios solved with real science taken to ridiculous extremes.

Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century
Description: Essays on contemporary challenges like politics
column6: and meaning in a rapidly changing world.

Author: Heather Morris
Title: The Tattooist of Auschwitz
Description: A Holocaust-era love and survival story based on the experiences of Lale Sokolov and Gita Furman in Auschwitz.

Author: Morton Rhue
Title: Die Welle
Description: A classroom experiment in authoritarianism spirals out of control; based on the “Third Wave” teaching experiment.

Author: William Golding
Title: Lord of the Flies
Description: Stranded boys attempt self-rule and descend into violence; exploring civility; power; and human nature.

Author: Wolf Haas
Title: Ausgebremst: Der Roman zur Formel 1
Description: A novel set around Formula 1 culture and obsession; framed in Haas’s darkly comic style.

Author: Richard David Precht
Title: Künstliche Intelligenz und der Sinn des Lebens: Ein Essay
Description: An essay-style reflection on how AI could reshape work

Author: Carla A. Harris
Title: Lead to Win: How to Be a Powerful
Description: Influential Leader in Any Environment
column6: A practical leadership playbook focused on influence

Author: Ray Bradbury
Title: Fahrenheit 451
Description: A dystopian novel where books are burned and conformity is enforced through censorship and mass media.

Author: David Grann
Title: Killers of the Flower Moon: The Osage Murders and the Birth of the FBI
Description: An investigative history of the Osage murders and the early development of the FBI.

Author: Carlos Fuentes
Title: Aura
Description: A short; eerie magical-realist novella told in second person; set in Mexico City and driven by obsession and doubling identities.

Author: Louis Sachar
Title: The Cardturner
Description: A teen becomes his rich uncle’s bridge “cardturner” and stumbles into secrets; skill; and growing up.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Title: Walden; or Life in the Woods
Description: A reflection on simple living and self-reliance drawn from Thoreau’s time at Walden Pond.

Author: Jordan B. Peterson
Title: 12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos
Description: A set of life “rules” blending psychology and philosophy into advice about responsibility and meaning.

Author: Paco Ardit
Title: Muerte en Buenos Aires (Spanish Novels for Beginners A1)
Description: A graded Spanish reader for beginners using a simple mystery narrative to build vocabulary and fluency.
